page.title: 12SHREWTON SILVER BAND
page.content: The Shrewton Silver Band was first formed around about 1850 and under their conductor the 'musicians' cur- rently meet for practice in the Vill- age Hall every Monday evening. The members young and old, male and female number between 30 - 35. At least half the members are Shrewton people, whilst others come regularly from up to 30 miles away, to enjoy the company and have a 'blow'. The range of wind instruments played include: Various Cornets, Flugel and Tenor Horns, Baritones, Trombones, Basses, Euphonium and percussion. They are kept busy during the summer months playing at Fetes, Charity Events, Parades and Church Services. Concerts are held regularly and Carols are played at Christmas time. Shrewton is very proud of its band which has an excellent reputation.
